section.title: Source Comments
section.text: River Hills Health System is not yet live on Hospice workflows in Epic yet.River Hills Health System

value.displayName: Propensity to adverse reactions to drug
Propensity to adverse reactions to drug

tr.td: Take 1 tablet (500 mg total) by mouth 2 (two) times a day with meals.
Take 1 tablet (50 mg total) by mouth daily.
Take 1 tablet (100 mcg total) by mouth daily.
Take 1 tablet (40 mg total) by mouth once a day in the evening.

td.paragraph: Diagnosed at age 50. Initially treated with diet & exercise. Metformin started 2014.

Diagnosed on routine lab screening in 1995. Initial attempts to control levels with diet, weight loss, and exercise unsuccessful. Patient started simvistatin in 1998. Mother died age 88 of CVA; father died age 74 of MI. Brother has elevated cholesterol without cardiovascular complications.
Diagnosed 1/25/95 by elevation of TSH after presentation for general exam with persistent fatigue as primary symptom. Synthroid started at that time. Family history negative for thyroid disease.

Diagnosed age 35. Initially treated with sodium restriction, diet, exercise. Diuretics started ~2000, taken sporadically since that time. Patient admits to poor compliance with med regimen. No history to suggest end organ damage or coronary artery disease. Cardiovascular risk factors include 20 pk yr hx of smoking and hypercholesterolemia.
Started smoking age 16, smoking 1 - 1.5 ppd. Has made several half-hearted attempts to quit but has never been successful for longer than a few days. Only smoker in the family.

tr.td: Quit smoking following episode of hemoptysis, negative bronchoscopy

td.paragraph: Exercise 3x per week (30 min per time)

text.paragraph: Patient has advance directives. For more information, please contact:
